title: UN AMB Arthur Goldberg June 6, 1967 Speech re: position of Sixth Fleet aircraft

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: UN AMB Arthur Goldberg June 6, 1967 Speech re: position of Sixth Fleet aircraft
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On June 6, 1967, at the United Nations prior to the conflict later to become known as the Six Day War, U.S. Ambassador Arthur Goldberg said to the Security Council that aircraft of the Sixth Fleet were several hundred miles from the conflict.

We are asking for a complete copy of the comments made by AMB Goldberg.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Joe Meadors

title: Flock oversight and data sharing

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Flock oversight and data sharing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Oak Park Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

1.  All Flock related records delivered to the citizen police oversight body including, but not limited to the following:
1.1  Searches conducted by the department
1.2  Searches by outside agencies that included the department's Flock network
1.3  Flock Activity reports
1.4  Memos and other reports

2. Current data sharing that includes:
2.1  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
2.2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
2.3  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
2.4  The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

RTL

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 11, 2024
Location: Miami Beach, FL
Suspects: Alon Alexander, Oren Alexander
Incident Summary: The Alexander brothers were arrested by Miami Beach Police as part of a multi-state investigation into alleged sex trafficking and sexual assault. The bodycam footage reportedly captures their arrest and subsequent interrogations, with Oren Alexander being transported to a police vehicle before questioning began approximately 10 minutes later. A similar interrogation took place with Alon Alexander in a separate room. The total footage reportedly lasts nearly two hours.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Participated in the arrests of Alon and Oren Alexander.
Transported the suspects.
Conducted or were present during their interrogations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Fusion Reports

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Fusion Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear NC ISAAC,

I am submitting a public records request under North Carolina General Statutes (NCGS) § 132-1 for any intelligence bulletins, threat assessments, situational awareness reports, or law enforcement notifications issued by NC ISAAC between February 21, 2025, and February 28, 2025.

Specifically, I request:
	1.	Any general or region-specific intelligence reports issued during this period.
	2.	Any alerts or warnings shared with local law enforcement agencies related to public safety concerns.
	3.	Any internal memos or communications summarizing relevant intelligence within this timeframe.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory exemption under which the information is being withheld. Additionally, if redactions are required, I request that you provide the non-exempt portions of the records in accordance with state law.

Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience and provide an estimated timeline for fulfillment. If any fees are associated with processing, I would appreciate a cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your time and cooperation. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

title: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Butchers of the Bayou," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Butchers of the Bayou."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: All unedited bodycam videos and 911 calls for case BA490599

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: All unedited bodycam videos and 911 calls for case BA490599
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all unedited/unredacted (if possible) bodycam footage and 911 calls related to the case of Daystar Peterson (BA490599). Please include transcripts of the calls and bodycam footage if available. One particular call is of great public interest: the call from Sean Kelly, the only independent eyewitness in this case. The public has not heard that call, nor have we seen the transcript of it. Other calls from witnesses who were not eyewitnesses have been released publicly. I would also like the original police reports associated with the case as well.

The  incident took place around 4:30am on 07/12/2020 in the Hollywood Hills neighborhood.  Cross streets Nichols Canyon Rd and Courtney Avenue.

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dana T.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2004 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

If your department does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian’s name and address.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

title: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the agency’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
 The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of share settings that include:
3.1 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
3.2 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
3.3 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
3.4 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

communications.subject: Public Records Request Inquiry 948
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This is to acknowledge DELC’s receipt of your request dated 02/27/2025 at 8:13 PM:

“To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:
1) Provider name or ID
2) Street number
3) Street name
4) City
5) Zip code
6) Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7) Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8) Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9) First license issue (open) date
10) Most recent license issue date
11) Most recent license expiration date or close date
12) Ages served for each year
13) Hours of operation for each year
14) QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15) Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16) Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17) Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18) Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. Sincerely, Gabrielle Pepin Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foregon-department-of-early-learning-and-care-35979%252Fchild-care-provider-data-182223%252F%253Femail%253DKris.REMMY%252540delc.oregon.gov&url_auth_token=AAG3JGu6ZMgu682BXFnl5LQKSvc%3A1tnrjJ%3AwXqf2ORiKbaGpNjOX3xY8XNxkULKYCZZZEAtk3cMUnc”

This is to confirm that DELC is the custodian of the requested records. Before we can proceed, we need some additional clarification.

There are no responsive records to the following data points, as requested:

  *   DELC does not collect, monitor, or track any data on license exempt providers, unless they are a recorded program.
  *   DELC does not monitor or track enrollment.
  *   DELC does monitor some provider types (center-based or home-based), but we do not monitor or track other specific program/service types.
  *   DELC monitors a provider’s acceptance of subsidies only if they are a current participant, so there is no historical data available.
  *   DELC does not monitor or track previous QRIS ratings, only the current QRIS rating of an active/most recent awarding.
  *   DELC does not monitor the price of services offered.

In addition, we are currently unable to determine if there is historical data for the following:

  *   Hours of operation.
  *   Ages served.

Pursuant to Oregon Revised Statues ORS 192.365, your request does not show by clear and convincing evidence that the public interest requires disclosure of the requested information for RF and CF facilities in this particular instance. Therefore, we are only able to share the following information:

     *   Active RF and CF facilities: Facility name and facility city/state/zip.
     *   Active CC facilities: Facility name, full facility address (street and number, city/state/zip).

The request for violation records spanning “as far back as the data systems allow” is denied. The request is too broad, and the information is available on our Child Safety Portal, as found here: Find Child Care Oregon - Find Child Care Oregon<https://findchildcareoregon.org/>

Oregon Revised Statues Referenced:


  *   ORS 192.365: Child care facility operator and exempt family child care provider information (residential address and telephone numbers, personal email addresses, personal cell phone numbers, Social Security numbers, employer-issued identification card numbers, and emergency contact information)

If you would like to proceed with a quote for the portions of your request that are available, please let me know by responding to this email.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​
Department of Early Learning and Care​
Public Records and Communication Specialist
DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov<mailto:DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov>
Website: Oregon.gov/DELC<https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/4T6sCW6qNgs52KYX8Ix6GqA?domain=oregon.gov>​
Connect with DELC: Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/OREarlyLearning/> | Instagram<https://www.instagram.com/OREarlyLearning/> | YouTube<https://www.youtube.com/@OREarlyLearning> | LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/OREarlyLearning/>

The Oregon Department of Early Learning and Care (DELC) fosters coordinated, culturally appropriate, and family-centered services that recognize and respect the strengths of children, families and early learning and care professionals. Our vision is that all children, families, early care and education professionals, and communities are supported and empowered to thrive.

title: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property (Vermont State Police)

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property (Vermont State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records from the Vermont State Police and the Vermont Attorney General’s Office concerning the investigation and resolution involving an Ezra M. Miller’s property in Stamford, Vermont in August 2022, as chronicled in the Rolling Stone article titled 'The Ezra Miller Saga Now Involves Vermont’s Child Services Department' (published August 10, 2022, available at: https://web.archive.org/web/20241215093133/https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/ezra-miller-vermont-child-services-department-1392572/). 
The article details attempts by Vermont State Police to serve an emergency care order on August 6, 7, and 9, 2022, at Miller’s 96-acre farm, intended to remove a 25-year-old mother and her three children amid supposed welfare concerns, with oversight by the Vermont Department for Children and Families (DCF) and potential involvement of the Vermont Attorney General’s Office in legal proceedings. 
Most notably, the article includes information or statements attributed to the Attorney’s Office suggesting the property owner was attempting to "evade" or "shield" someone.


Specifically, I seek the following from August 1, 2022, through December 31, 2023:  

- Vermont State Police incident reports, affidavits, dispatch logs, recordings or transcripts of any 911 calls received or made, and bodycam footage related to attempts to serve the emergency care order at Miller’s Stamford property on August 6, 7, and 9, 2022, or in connection with the welfare of the mother and her three children that prompted police responses on those dates; plus any police records documenting subsequent actions or follow-up related to aforementioned alleged child welfare concerns at the property after August 9, 2022.  

- Vermont Attorney General’s Office correspondence (e.g., emails, memos, letters, documents, etc) with Vermont State Police or DCF regarding the emergency care order, its execution, or its resolution; legal opinions or memoranda concerning its enforcement; and any court filings, hearing records, or notices related to the emergency care order or to additional later hearings (referenced in the Rolling Stone article) scheduled on or after August 10, 2022.  

- Any relevant correspondence between Vermont State Police and the Vermont Attorney General’s Office concerning the welfare of the mother and her three children or the execution of the emergency care order. if any responsive records are held by DCF or even out-of-state agencies, I request coordination with that agency or referral of my request to ensure relevant obtainable documents are obtained.

I request that any exempt personal information (e.g., names of minors or private individuals) be redacted rather than withholding documents entirely, consistent with the Vermont Public Records Act’s presumption of disclosure (1 V.S.A. § 315 et seq.).
I am not affiliated with any news agencies & this request is not being made for commercial purposes. This inquiry serves the public interest by shedding light on the resolution of a widely publicized matter (yet for some reason never followed up on by news organizations) involving child welfare and inter-agency action, fostering transparency in governmental proceedings, and discouraging vigilante justice from members of the public who, due to rampant disinformation by omission, might be inclined to take matters into their own hands against a perceived child abductor.  

If there are any issues with the scope or specificity of this request, please contact me to discuss it before denying or delaying the response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PJ

communications.subject: City of Portage, MI - Records Request Confirmation Public Safety Record Request - PS-2025-200
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to the City of Portage, MI.  Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq.  Your request was received in this office on Thursday, February 27, 2025 and given the reference number Request Number: PS-2025-200 for tracking purposes.  Please have this reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume of documents and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Michigan Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq,  does not require a governmental body to create new information, do legal research, or answer questions. 
  
 The City of Portage has 5 days to respond to this request.  If additional time to process your request is needed, you will be contacted by the City of Portage office responsible for responding to your request. 
  
 If your request was for Public Safety (Police/Fire) Records, please contact the Public Safety office at FOIA-PublicSafety@portagemi.gov or by calling (269) 329-4568.  If your request was for General City Records (or Environmental Site Assessment Info), please contact the Office of the City Clerk at cityclerk@portagemi.gov or by calling (269) 329-4511.

title: Permits database

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Permits database
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

The database of all hunting licenses issued in Pennsylvania from January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024, including all non-exempt columns and tables of the database. 

We request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

Fee Waiver Request:
A waiver of search and review fees is appropriate here because disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) and 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(a), (b)(1)-(2), and because the request is not primarily in our commercial interest, 45 C.F.R. §§ 5.45(a), (b)(3)(ii).

This Request is Not Primarily in Our Commercial Interest:
The requested information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(a). We are news media requesters that can and will “effectively convey information to the public.” 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(b)(2)(ii).

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis:
In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, we ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

Limitation of Fees:
We are also entitled to a limitation of fees because we are members of the news media. 45 C.F.R. § 5.53(b); 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). Accordingly, even if our application for a waiver of all fees is denied, we are entitled to a limitation of fees. As a news media requester, we are“entitled to search time, review time, and up to 100 pages of duplication” and can be charged only duplication fees after the first 100 pages or its cost equivalent. 45 C.F.R. § 5.53(b). We request that the information be provided in its native electronic format, and thus there should be no duplication fees.

Request for Explanation of Withholdings and Redactions:
If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a reasonable description of any withheld materials and a justification for all such withholdings that includes reference to the specific FOIA exemptions authorizing withholding and specific reasons why such exemptions apply. 45 C.F.R. § 5.31. An agency shall withhold information only if “the agency reasonably foresees that disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption” or “disclosure is prohibited by law.” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8)(A)(i). (Per Attorney General Garland’s March 15, 2022 memorandum, “In case of doubt [regarding foreseeable harm or legal bar to disclosure], openness should prevail.”We therefore request that if the agency determines that an exemption applies, specific reasons be provided as to why disclosure would harm any interest protected by such exemption. An agency shall also “consider whether partial disclosure of information is possible whenever the agency determines that a full disclosure of a requested record is not possible” and “take reasonable steps necessary to segregate and release nonexempt information.” Id. at § 552(a)(8)(A)(ii). We therefore request that the agency release all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: RE: [External] Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Permits database
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Requests for records under the RTKL must be made on the Office of Open Records (OOR) Standard Right-to-Know Law Request Form.  A PDF copy can be found here<https://www.openrecords.pa.gov/Documents/RTKL/RTKRequestForm.pdf>.  The Pennsylvania Game Commission (PGC) will not act upon requests for records outside the OOR's Standard Form.  The PGC adopts this policy pursuant to Section 504(a) of the Right-to-Know Law, 65 §§ P.S. 67.101-67.3104 (RTKL).  Please fill out the Standard Right-to-Know Law Request Form and resubmit your request.  You can find the PGC's Right-to-Know Law Policy here<https://www.pa.gov/services/pgc/submit-a-right-to-know-request.html>.

Sincerely,

Zachary Fahnestock
Agency Open Records Officer
Office of Chief Counsel
Pennsylvania Game Commission
2001 Elmerton Avenue
Harrisburg, PA 17110

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 02/20/2025
Location: High Pines neighborhood, Miami-Dade County, FL
Suspect: Tykwon Anderson, 20
Incident Summary: Deputies arrested Anderson in connection with a burglary at the home of University of Miami quarterback Carson Beck. Anderson and three others allegedly broke in around 2:45 a.m., stole a garage opener from a white Range Rover, and used it to enter the residence, where they took vehicle key fobs. Surveillance footage captured the stolen vehicles leaving the neighborhood. Bodycam footage reportedly includes interactions with both Beck and his girlfriend, Hanna Cavinder, as well as the arrest of Anderson.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the burglary and theft.
Arrested Tykwon Anderson.
Interacted with Carson Beck and Hanna Cavinder.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Cybercheck Communications and Agreements

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Cybercheck Communications and Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Portage County Sheriff's Office and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. All email exchanges, including attachments, between Portage County Sheriff's Office staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. All emails, including attachments, between staff of Portage County Sheriff's Office that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

title: Amira Fox - 20th Circuit State's Attorney - Criminal information - State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Amira Fox - 20th Circuit State's Attorney - Criminal information - State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns your office's litigation in 2 appeals.  Huminski v. State, 2d19-1914 & 2d19-1247, Florida 2 DCA, Ashley Moody, esq.  Trial court, State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815, Lee County Court.  See below,

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law please supply;

    1. Any document filed in the Lee County Court in 2017 that contains a criminal statute relied upon by the State of Florida to achieve plaintiff status and standing in State v. Huminski and the 
        2 related  appeals litigated by your office (2d19-1247, 2d19-1914).  Such a document is supportive of your legitimate participation as Appellee in the 2 appeals.

    2. Absent a document specified in paragraph 1, please supply any document supporting the party status as Plaintiff in State v. Huminski that provided standing concerning  the State of 
         Florida in State v. Huminski (a jurisdictional requirement).

    4. In the absence of any of the above documents, please supply any document, recording, emails, letters, invoices, financial records, medical records, employment files, police reports, 
         photographs, text messages, and any other relevant documents/materials concerning the Statutory basis for the State of Florida's participation in State v. Huminski as a criminal plaintiff.

(See attached .pdf files)

Related supportive links,
Florida Ethics Commission complaints,

          https://www.indybay.org/newsitems/2024/11/25/18871016.php

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/merge_notary_thru_mailing.pdf

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/12/04/amira_final_merge_comp.pdf

          https://www.change.org/p/gov-desantis-remove-state-s-attorney-amira-fox-corruption-official-crime

To aid the reply to this document request, the printed case 2D19-1914 can be found at the below links,

          https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

          https://web.archive.org/web/20201005171650/https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/record_on_appeal_2019-1914_comp64mb.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

scott huminski

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on September 26, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 26, 2024
Location: Dick’s Sporting Goods, 1587 Fruitville Pike, Lancaster, PA 17601
Suspect: Melissa Jean Musti, 42
Incident Summary: Officers responded to a shoplifting incident at Dick’s Sporting Goods. While taking the suspect into custody, Musti struck a victim in the back of the head and bit another on the forearm. She repeatedly yelled profanities, causing public alarm, and resisted arrest by pulling away and flailing her arms. Musti was charged with aggravated assault, obstruction of justice, resisting arrest, and disorderly conduct and was committed to Lancaster County Prison.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the shoplifting incident.
Interacted with Melissa Jean Musti.
Took Musti into custody.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun
